title: Drake Maye talks starting fast, capitalizing in the red zone, and the throws he wished he had back
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Drake Maye acknowledged rushing some throws in the Patriots' loss to the Raiders, including missing open receivers.
Patriots struggled in the red zone, converting only 1 of 3 opportunities, while Raiders scored on their sole attempt.
Maye completed 30 of 46 passes for 287 yards and feels optimistic about offensive progress under Coach Mike Vrabel.

title: What Celtics star Jaylen Brown said about potentially playing for hometown team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jaylen Brown acknowledged potential future interest in playing for his hometown team, the Atlanta Hawks, during a radio interview.
Brown remains a key player for the Celtics, with four years left on a $304 million supermax contract signed in 2023.
Despite trade rumors, Brad Stevens confirmed Brown's role as a leader in the reworked Celtics roster for the upcoming season.

title: Whatâ€™s causing vibration in my 15-year-old car?
author: John Paul
bullets: John Paul suggests checking tire balance and inspecting tires and wheels for flat spots as potential vibration causes.
Steering and suspension wear might worsen vibrations and should be examined when the car is on a lift.
Reader's 2010 Mazda Miata has 39,000 miles and shows slight vibration at highway speeds.

title: 17-year-old stabbed inside Roxbury high school, no arrests, police say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A 17-year-old was stabbed in a hallway at Madison Park High School in Roxbury around noon Wednesday.
The student suffered a minor, non-life threatening stab wound and was transported to a hospital.
The suspect fled the scene and no arrests have been made as the investigation remains ongoing.

title: Report: Ex-Patriots QB Mac Jones is ‘in line’ to start for 49ers on Sunday
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Former Patriots QB Mac Jones is expected to start for the 49ers against the Saints on Sunday.
49ers QB Brock Purdy is sidelined with shoulder and toe injuries, potentially missing multiple weeks.
Jones signed a two-year, $8.1 million deal with the 49ers and is second on their depth chart.

title: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk dies after being shot at Utah college event, Trump says
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk, 31, was shot and killed at a Utah Valley University event.
The suspected shooter has not been arrested; a detained person is not the suspect, according to authorities.
The shooting sparked bipartisan condemnation and has raised concerns about increased political violence in the U.S.

title: Patriots’ defensive coordinator Terrell Williams will be away from team for a few days
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots defensive coordinator Terrell Williams to be away from the team due to an unforeseen health issue.
Coach Mike Vrabel announced the absence, emphasizing Williams' health priority and mentioned no connection to a past incident.
Inside linebackers coach Zak Kuhr may fill in; defensive play-calling for Dolphins game still undecided.

title: 8 unforgettable fall destinations in Vermont, according to Boston.com readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Franklin County's Lamoille and Missisquoi Valley Rail Trails offer scenic fall hiking and biking.
Scenic Route 100 Byway in Vermont provides a popular drive for viewing autumn foliage.
Lake Champlain in Vermont noted for nearby cabins, antique shopping, and proximity to Canada.

title: Readers: Are cider doughnuts ever bad?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Cider doughnuts are a quintessential fall treat in New England, best enjoyed during the autumn season.
Apple cider doughnut expert Alex Schwartz highlights texture and sugar balance as key qualities for a good doughnut.
Readers previously recommended Bolton Spring Farm, Carver Hill Orchard, and Smolak Farms for top-tier cider doughnuts.

title: Review & setlist: Dua Lipa ramps up the energy, and the electricity, at TD Garden
author: Annie Jonas and Kelly Chan
bullets: Dua Lipa performed at TD Garden in Boston on September 9, 2025, for her 'Radical Optimism Tour.'
'Radical Optimism' album features new material following the success of her 2020 album 'Future Nostalgia.'
Dua Lipa covered Aerosmith's 'I Don't Want to Miss a Thing' and interacted with international fans.
